prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Terry Fawles
Description: My client. Sentenced to death 5 years ago. Escaped from custody 2 days ago.
Character 1
Name: Valerie Hawthorne
Description: Police officer and the victim. The key witness in the case against Fawles 5 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Diego Armando
Description: A hot-shot lawyer. My senior and rival at the office. A bit smug.
Character 3
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Dubbed a genius as soon as he started as a prosecutor. Today is his court debut.
Character 4
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective in charge of the initial investigation. Still new to his position.
Character 5
Name: Melissa Foster
Description: A college student. Witnessed and photographed the incident on Dusky Bridge.
Character 6
Name: Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Valerie's younger sister. Victim of the kidnap/murder at Dusky Bridge 5 years ago.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. It's brand-new and sparkles in the light.
Evidence 1
Name: Valerie's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed with a knife in the back. Died from blood loss between 4 and 5 PM.
Evidence 2
Name: Dusky Bridge Map
Description: Bridge located 40 feet above Eagle River. [caption] The bridge is broken midway towards the east. It connects to the parking lot towards the west. The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks. Under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed.
Evidence 3
Name: Victim's Note
Description: Confidential police materials written by the victim. [info] 

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.
Evidence 4
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the trunk of Fawles's car. [caption] The victim appears to be dead, curled up in the trunk. She was wearing a coat and no scarf. The coat is dry and clean. The trunk opener appears to be tampered.
Evidence 5
Name: Scarf
Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.
Evidence 6
Name: Witness's Photo
Description: Seems to have been taken by the witness. Click here for details. Taken by the witness. Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera
Description: Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. A small but powerful model. Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. Has a timer function.
Evidence 8
Name: Diamond
Description: A 2 million dollar gem. Used as ransom for Dahlia. Lost to Eagle River 5 years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the incident, an unknown person phoned the sergeant and asked to meet.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sergeant Hawthorne went to Dusky Bridge at the designated time and met with Mr. Fawles.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: And that's where she was brutally murdered, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The criminal stuffed her body into his car trunk and tried to make a getaway.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: Here's a photo of the trunk. But I don't see anything strange, do you? Anyway...
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: Mr. Fawles was arrested at a police checkpoint we set up at the base of the mountain.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Testimony 3 by Gumshoe states: "The criminal stuffed her body into his car trunk and tried to make a getaway." The corresponding Evidence 4, the Crime Photo, shows the victim's coat to be dry and clean—suggesting Valerie's body was not exposed to the outdoor elements on Dusky Bridge, where her scarf was found wet and muddy (Evidence 5). This presents a contradiction: If the body was immediately put in the trunk after the murder on the muddy, wet bridge, the coat should also be wet and dirty, not dry and clean.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Actually, there's an eyewitness who was there when the incident took place.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This photo was accidentally taken by the witness. It shows the vic wearing the scarf, sir.
Person: Gumshoe

cot:
Testimony 3 claims that "the criminal shoved the victim down from behind and stabbed her in the back," implying the victim was pushed off the bridge and fell down to the river/rocks. 

However, Evidence 4 (Crime Photo) shows the victim curled up, dead, in the trunk of Fawles's car, with her coat dry and clean. If the victim had been shoved off Dusky Bridge, her body would be at the riverbed below, not in the car trunk, and certainly not with clean, dry clothing. This contradicts the idea that she was pushed down from the bridge at the time of the stabbing.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I... I was using my camera to take some pictures of wild flowers.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 1
Testimony: Then, I noticed there were two people standing up on the suspension bridge.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 2
Testimony: Suddenly, they just started fighting!
Person: Melissa
Testimony 3
Testimony: That's when I hurried and took the photo that shows the crucial moment.
Person: Melissa

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies looking for contradictions.

Focus on Geography:
Evidence 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) description:
- "The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks."

Melissa (Witness) says (repeated in both Evidence 6 and her captions):
- "Umm... I was standing right over... here. I was standing to the south of the bridge."

Now, Testimony 3 (Melissa):
- "That's when I hurried and took the photo that shows the crucial moment."
(Related to the Witness's Photo — Evidence 6 — which clearly shows the victim and the perpetrator.)

But per Evidence 2, if Melissa was to the south, her view to the place the incident occurred (i.e., the parking lot end of the bridge) would have been obstructed. Therefore, she couldn't have "hurried and took the photo that shows the crucial moment" from there.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 2 and Testimony 3.

cot:
Evidence 4, the Crime Photo, shows that the victim's coat is dry and clean despite being found in the trunk after allegedly being picked up and carried over by the accused. Melissa's testimony 1 states, "Then he carried her over to the car." However, the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2) describes that the bridge is located 40 feet above Eagle River, with a sharp and solid rock bed below, and large rocks obstruct the view. Being carried from the south side (where Melissa stood) to the parking lot side would require crossing a broken bridge, making it impossible for someone to be carried over—especially with rocks, distance, and the dangerous geography between points.

Therefore, Evidence 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) and Testimony 1 (Melissa: "Then he carried her over to the car.") contradict each other regarding the feasibility of moving the body.

Testimony 0
Testimony: I... I was out of the country until the year before last.

Person: Melissa

cot:
Testimony 3 by Melissa states: "And I certainly don't have any reason for wanting to hurt a police officer." This suggests she had no motive against the victim.

However, Evidence 3, the Victim's Note, reveals Valerie was supposed to "talk to Dahlia" (her sister) about "the whole truth." Dahlia is Melissa's real identity (as evidenced by the connection to the 5-years-ago case). Valerie intended to expose a secret or crime involving Dahlia, providing a very strong motive for a relative (Melissa/Dahlia) to harm her before the secret could be revealed.

Testimony 0
Testimony: Five years ago, I was kidnapped by Mr. Fawles.

cot: Testimony 3 by Dahlia claims: "That's when Mr. Fawles tried to kill me by shoving me off the bridge from behind!" This suggests that she was pushed off and presumably could survive the fall, making the act an attempted murder. However, Evidence 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) describes the bridge as being 40 feet above Eagle River, with "a sharp and solid rock bed" beneath. This makes it extremely unlikely that someone pushed off the bridge would survive, which casts doubt on Dahlia's claim of survival and therefore contradicts her account of being shoved off.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 by Fawles states: "Finally, one woman came. She stood front of me." This implies that Fawles met Valerie face-to-face on the bridge.

However, Evidence 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) reveals: "The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks." Furthermore, Evidence 6 (Witness's Photo) shows the positions: "the victim [Valerie], wearing scarf and hat, is standing to the right, facing left... standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left."

Taken together, the map suggests the bridge is broken midway towards the east, and the obstructed view would have made a direct meeting more difficult—particularly as the bridge is impassable and broken. Thus, Fawles's claim that he stood on the bridge and talked to Valerie face-to-face is contradicted by the map, which indicates that the bridge is broken and possibly uncrossable at midway, preventing them from meeting in the position he describes.
